REBECCA (0.S.) (CONT’D) (distant) Bret! Come here!  77. DIANA’S VOICE (imitating Rebecca) Come here. The passcode screen goes dark again-- AND DIANA IS RIGHT IN FRONT OF HIM. Even this close, she appears almost two-dimensional until-- Bret is struck across the face-- And he stumbles backward over an end table, spilling near front foyer. The PHONE lands on the floor, face down. A tiny halo of refreshed light from the screen. Some dark foot SMASHES IT, and the light goes out. Bret gets up again, bleeding from the face, and he runs a fast as he fucking can for the front door. EXT. SOPHIE’S HOUSE Out the front he goes, flinging the door behind him-- And stumbling on the porch step. No-- worse. Like something had hold of one leg. It’s outside. It should feel safe. But the blackout is al the entire block, and the new moon makes this world anyth but safe and well-lit.

dialogues.speaker: BRET
dialogues.text: His lip is bloody from hitting it when he fell. More bloo flows from gashes on his face and neck. He fumbles for his car keys. Gets up once more. The KEY FOB is in his hand now but--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From across the street. A dark FIGURE, so dark it’s as if it were made of nothing grabs Bret by the neck and LIFTS HIM OFF HIS FEET with on arm. He struggles, legs flailing, arm raised-- And then he presses the ‘unlock’ button on the key fob--  78. And his SUV’s headlights suddenly SHINE on the front of t house and in that very same breath-- Bret seems suspended in midair by nothing, and promptly f back to the front lawn.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO BRET
dialogues.text: Gasping for air. Terrified and confused. He’s in fight-or-flight and flight has won. Bret rushes f his SUV, climbs in, mashes the dome light, and starts it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebecca and Martin are still huddled by the door. Straini to listen. They hear the SUV engine start. And then the sound of the vehicle peeling out and away. Rebecca's heart sinks.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: Is he leaving?

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: No. He wouldn’t... He wouldn’t do that, would he? The reality sets in: They’re alone in the basement. With monster in the house.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: You did. He’s eight years old, he doesn’t say it to be mean, he sa it matter-of-factly; it makes sense to him. Rebecca’s been strong up until now, but the significance that hits her so hard, she struggles not to cry. The commercial-grade flashlight flickers. Once. Twice. Both of them tense up.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Oh no, do not die on me--

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: I forgot to tell you, the big ones are battery hogs.  79. She snaps out of her heartbreak, takes a breath for coura and gets back into problem-solving mode.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Let’s make some other light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sophie opens her door, emerging from the master bedroom a the white noise of an air purifier.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE
dialogues.text: Rebecca? Hello? Sophie sees Martin’s door open. Steps to the threshold... No one’s there. Sophie tries the light switch-- nothing. She tenses.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Martin? Distant noises from deep within the house, below: The sou of Rebecca and Martin scavenging in the basement.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Diana, where are you? A creak from the bedroom, and Sophie sees her-- the famil SILHOUETTE standing inside the master bedroom door. She's taller than ever, now. Like she’s getting bigger. Sophie is scared, but finds her anger and approaches, challenging the shadow:

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I told you not to bother my kids. Diana steps aside as Sophie gets close, vanishing behind door so that when Sophie enters, she shuts the door to confront Diana but-- No one’s there.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Diana? We're not through, here. (then) Don’t make me punish you! THE BEDROOM DOORKNOB LOCKS by itself... Then--  80. Diana GRABS Sophie from behind and THROWS her against a w --where Sophie CRASHES into a bureau and collapses to the floor, unconscious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fire flickers from gas tubing. We're in: An iron “fireplace” stove with a large ventilation pipe. one time, before central air/heating was a thing, this basement was kept warm with this wood-burning heater. But now there is no wood. It hasn’t been used in years. Rebecca shoves crinkled newspaper into the mouth of the thing, and the flames catch it, offering the room some fleeting warm light. Behind Rebecca, Martin holds the weakening flashlight.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: Rebecca...

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: Hurry.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: I know! Rebecca starts scavenging for whatever she can find. She grabs a cardboard box’s lid. And then from the box, an old stuffed ANIMAL missing one button-eye. And a stack of yellowed MAGAZINES. All of it goes into the stove’s mouth. The junk doesn’t catch fire right away. Martin hears something in the dark: CLICKING toenails. Scurrying sounds from somewhere. He sweeps the flashlight around. Its beam has narrowed.  81. DIANA’S VOICE (sing-song) Maaaaartin... Martin tenses. Rebecca blows on the fire. Puts her hand in and grabs som burning newsprint to try and spread it. The flashlight flickers. Martin tries to keep it everywhere at once. All he succeeds in doing is make the shadows in the room dance and sway. The plastic, four-foot-tall “wise men” figures trotted out for the lawn in December continue to humanoid shadows on the wall. Martin keeps his focus on them. From directly above him... matted jet-black hair DESCENDS like she’s perched on the rafter above him-- DIANA’S VOICE (CONT’D) (sotto) Brush your hair-- Martin freaks and points the flashlight directly up-- And, like flashlights with batteries in the handle, it ca the light to nearly go out, flickering-- Martin backs up, but just in the nick of time-- The STUFFED ANIMAL in the stove catches fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The corner of the room by the stove is saturated in the g of the fire. Rebecca did it. Martin sits down, already exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: That won’t last more than a few minutes. We need to find more stuff to burn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebecca and Martin dig through boxes.  82. Anything deemed burnable gets tossed in a pile near the stove. Martin’s lack of sleep is catching up with him. Fatigue i setting in.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: (re: her file box) Mom saved her tax forms from ten years ago. She’s still got receipts in here. Rebecca puts a stuffed folder of papers on the pile.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: How long are we gonna stay in here?

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: I don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: There aren’t any windows.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: I’m working on a plan. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: I’m not much good to you.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: You're doing great. Feed the fire for a while. Martin does so. Rebecca scoots a new file box from one shelf and sits dow with it by the stove. On the side: the box is labeled “REBECCA.”

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What’s this? My old clothes? She opens it. Inside: a lone SHOE BOX. Rebecca pulls this out and opens this. She lifts out a set of developed PHOTOGRAPHS. Goes throug them, curious.  83. THE PHOTOS: Birthday cakes, all taken on the dining table upstairs. Sixteen candles. Seventeen. Then eighteen.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She made birthday cakes?

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: Every year, on your birthday.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: But, I was in San Diego those years. Mom knew that.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: She made them anyway. We sang the song for you. This is news to Rebecca. She pulls out the other material the shoe box... LETTERS. Folded into personal envelopes. Unmailed. Each w dates on the front.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: She wrote me letters? Rebecca opens one. Unfolds the paper. Martin glances at them, then returns to feeding the fire.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: Yeah. She did that a lot. Rebecca reads one. Aside from a quick look over her shoulder at the handwrit letters on lined paper, we don’t see the content. We just see Rebecca’s face as she reads. Whatever is in the content, it affects her deeply. By page two, she starts to tremble. By page three, she’s in tears. At the end, she sniffs, wipes her eyes, and stuffs the le back in its envelope. It’s one of maybe a dozen. Gently, as if it were a newborn infant, Rebecca places th shoe box back in the larger file box. Martin watches.  84.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What did it say? Rebecca lets out a breath. Doesn’t directly answer his question, but looks him in the eye to say:

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: We are going to help mom. I will find a way to get rid of Diana. The fire crackles. Martin nods at his sister, then gets t energy to grab another box from the other side of the sto This one is marked ‘HALLOWEEN.’ As he digs through it, Rebecca puts a protective hand on file box containing her mother’s letters to her.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey, I found a flashlight. She looks over to see Martin has a rectangular light tube

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Or something. He turns it on-- its batteries work. But it casts a cold blue/green glow on Martin.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: That's a black light. (beat) But a light’s a light. He hands it to her. She shines it around.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Still got some juice. Rebecca takes a breath, steels her nerves, and advances f another corner of the basement. The black light casts a deep blue hue over all the stored junk in this space. Rebecca moves from the fire. One step at a time. Martin watches, scared and exhausted all at once.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: Where are you going?  85.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: To take inventory. With the glove of the amber fire at her back, and the blu glow in front of her, Rebecca navigates the nest of shelv and boxes. Somewhere in the dark, the sound of scurrying feet. Rebecca tenses. She moves for the next aisle. The black light reveals FOOT PRINTS on the floor-- And occasional HAND PRINTS on other items. Rebecca looks down to see the wan glow of a similar hand print ON HER OWN SHIRT SLEEVE. Like a mark of ownership. Freaked, Rebecca rubs the sleeve to smear the print. In moving her arm with the black light, she reveals -- HANDWRITING on a far wall. Just a faint glimpse of it. Invisible without the black light. Rebecca ventures toward it, past a shelf, holding the lig up to get a closer look... ..+.The wall is covered in Diana’s scrawled writing. Like journal of a prisoner of war. Just a taste of the blanket run-on sentences written over the course of years --

dialogues.speaker: SHE MISSES HER CHILD PRETTY CHILD PRETTY DOLL
dialogues.text: It’s enough to freak Rebecca out. She turns away from it. At the other end of the shelf, among other junk: the blac light illuminates a gardening spade with a long wooden gr A weapon. Potentially. Makeshift, but still. More scurrying in the dark. This time to her right. Rebecca shines the black light into a darkened corner whe rack of clothes hangs -- leftover inventory from one of Paul’s years at the shop.  86. But wait. There’s a HUMANOID FIGURE standing there too-- Standing and staring at us in the blue-tinted darkness. Wild, long hair. Eyes that shine like a cat’s. And teeth GLOW in the black light. Eyes and teeth. She’s so still s looks like a Halloween lawn-scarecrow but-- Then SHE MOVES, back out of sight and we realize HOLY SHI YES THAT WAS DIANA. Rebecca nearly jumps out of her skin-- She hurries for the gardening spade at the end of the ais Looking back-- More scurrying sounds-- Where is that monster now-- Rebecca gets to the end and grabs the wooden handle. The spade is laid lengthwise on the shelf, so the metal shove end sticks out the other side, on the other aisle. She starts to pull it away-- And it sticks. Like it’s hung up on something. Rebecca shines the light to see what’s caught it-- And the black light shines right in DIANA’S FACE on the o side of the aisle. It’s only visible for a dozen frames of the film, but her mouth is distorted; bigger than a human’s mouth, and full crooked teeth. Her eyes are milky like they have cataract And she hisses at Rebecca.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No! Rebecca falls back, still clutching the spade in one hand crashing against another shelf, toppling it-- Scrambling to escape, to find that black light-- Shit, she dropped that-- Scurrying sound again-- Rebecca reaches for the black light--  87. But then a bare ARM black as an oil slick slams down on h snaring her wrist, in the glow of the black light-- Diana's matted, black hair suddenly sinking close to Rebecca’s face-- And then a weak FLASHLIGHT BEAM lands on Diana’s arm-- And in an inhuman SCREECH, Diana is gone faster than a jumping spider. MARTIN steps close, holding the big flashlight as it sput out again.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: Come on! Rebecca grabs the black light, the spade, and they move b to the corner with the fireplace. She takes a breath. Martin guts the flashlight’s batteries and switches them around.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sometimes this gives you a little more juice.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: I saw her. I got a clear look at her. (holds black light) She doesn’t disappear in this light. She’s real.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: So, if I can see her, at least I know where she is. I can keep her from vanishing. (points at flashlight) And with that thing, maybe I can even hurt her. She hefts the gardening spade like a short spear. Heavy footfall overhead. Someone thumping around upstairs Martin and Rebecca both look up.  88.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: What is she doing now? Rebecca doesn’t answer right away; she doesn’t know. Then: something echoes inside the stove’s piping. Another loud WHUMP as something wet lands in the stove’s immediately SNUFFING IT OUT.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now what? Rebecca stares at the ceiling for a beat. Smoke begins to fill the lit space where they’re huddled.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Mom! ! INT. SOPHIE’S BEDROOM - NIGHT Sophie is still unconscious on the floor. Unresponsive.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (distant) Mommmm !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebecca and Martin keep CALLING until Martin’s flashlight starts sputtering out again. All that’s left is Rebecca's black light. She pulls her brother close, and they back into a corner. His eyes are wide with fear.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: Are we going to die?

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: No. We're fighters. She holds onto him. Trying to give him a brave face. But honestly, she doesn’t know what to do next. And then, in the distance: the sound of SIRENS. Rebecca perks up. Suddenly hopeful.  89.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An LAPD squad car comes tearing down the street. As it approaches, half a block before Sophie’s house, the siren are shut off, and it runs only with the lights. Tailing the squad car: Bret’s SUV. The cops pull to the curb outside Sophie’s house. Bret’s SUV skids to a halt, nearly rear-ending the squad Bret climbs out, leaving his headlights on. He still looks bloody, his shirt stained with it. Someone attempted to bandage his neck but it’s clear he left befo they could finish the job. Now that he’s back, Bret doesn’t take his eyes off the ho Two LAPD OFFICERS get out of the squad car. One male, one female. Both cool, calm, and collected. The male is OFFICER FORM; 30s, tall, African-American. The female is OFFICER GOMEZ; early 30s, muscular, two str on her uniform indicate she’s the senior officer. Bret’s already pointing and talking--

dialogues.speaker: BRET
dialogues.text: She's in there, my girlfriend and her family--

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER GOMEZ
dialogues.text: Sir, please return to your car, you need to get to the hospital--

dialogues.speaker: BRET
dialogues.text: Listen to me, you need flashlights.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER FORM
dialogues.text: Get back in your car, sir. Said loudly. Bret backs up. But notices he’s not quite in the light of SUV's beams, and takes a side-step into them. The two Officers approach the house. Its front door remains partly open. Officer Gomez speaks into her shoulder radio handset:  90.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER GOMEZ
dialogues.text: Unit eighty-one, we’re at the Marigold house, power grid is out. Over. Officer Form looks back at his partner when they get to t door, then gets his flashlight out and knocks on the door

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER FORM
dialogues.text: LAPD. Anyone home? The door opens from his knocking. He shines the light into the living room. Overturned furniture from the attack on Bret gives the pl the look of a war zone.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER FORM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (louder) Hello?

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (muffled) Help! The Officers hear that. They go inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Officers reach the hall with the door to the basement

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER GOMEZ
dialogues.text: LAPD, we're responding to a domestic disturbance?

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: In here! Officer Form springs into action and kicks the door. It doesn’t give on the first kick, so he goes again--

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER GOMEZ
dialogues.text: (into radio) Unit eighty-one, possible fire at residence, alert LAFD-- BOOM! The door is kicked in. Officer Form shines the ligh down the stairs at-- Rebecca and Martin, who remain in the corner, Rebecca sti holding her gardening spade.  91. A thin veil of smoke displaced from the stove hangs in th room, creeping out into the hall. Like a residual fog.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER FORM
dialogues.text: You okay? DOWN THE HALL, Diana’s silhouette appears. Gomez notices. Puts a hand on her partner's shoulder-- Form sees her--

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER FORM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ma’ am? He shines the light down the hall-- but Diana is gone. Officer Form draws his sidearm and advances down the hall with the flashlight before him. Officer Gomez stays at the door where she can keep sight her partner and call down to Rebecca--

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER GOMEZ
dialogues.text: Can you move? Rebecca grabs Martin and moves up the stairs, saying:

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Keep the light on us! INT. SOPHIE’S BEDROOM - THAT MOMENT Sophie gets up, a trickle of blood marking a path on her from where she was thrown. She sets upon the door to the hall, determined. It’s lodged, somehow. Can’t open. So she starts bashing the door with whatever she can find

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE
dialogues.text: Diana! You hurt my children and we are never speaking again! WHANG! She starts to dislodge the doorknob. WHANG! Again, weakening the door.  92.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The upstairs sound is muted down here with all the chaos. At the end of the hall, Officer Form looks for where the figure disappeared.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER FORM
dialogues.text: Show yourself! BACK WITH GOMEZ, she sees her partner check down one part the family room where the hallway ends-- And then that silhouette ATTACKS from behind, pulling him of Gomez's view-- But it’s so quick, neither has time to react--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer Form crashes hard on a card table-- His flashlight resting on the floor by the hall-- And DIANA stands before him. Menacing. We can’t see that insane face but we know it’s there; we can hear her raspy breath through that too-big mouth... Officer Form raises his sidearm--

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER FORM
dialogues.text: Back off! But she takes a step toward him-- BLAM! He fires-- And in the muzzle flash from the Glock SHE DISAPPEARS-- But a fraction of a second later, the moment the flash dissipates, she’s A STEP CLOSER-- He fires AGAIN-- to the same effect--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gomez hears her partner firing once, then twice, then a t time before he WAILS IN AGONY out of view--

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER GOMEZ
dialogues.text: Andrew! (into handset) Eleven ninety-nine! Get me backup!  93. Gomez has her gun drawn. Flashlight in the other hand. Tr to control her breathing. Rebecca and Martin huddle close to the Officer. Footsteps from elsewhere in the house. The sound bounces around -- upstairs, in the basement, like someone playing game with them. Gomez is taut as a wire, changing the grip on her Glock. OFFICER GOMEZ (CONT’D) How many are there?

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Use this. You won’t see her otherwise. Rebecca offers the black light. But Gomez instead moves for the back room where her partn was last seen. Rebecca checks on Martin.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You okay? Martin nods weakly.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We're getting out -- now -- Martin holds onto Rebecca with pleading eyes.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: Mom.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: We'll find her too. A cut-off SCREAM from Gomez in the dark. Close by. But th battery-operated smoke detector begins WAILING, drowning all other sound, like a nail-biting soundtrack. Rebecca looks for her and sees a SILHOUETTE approaching f down the hall. The smoke thins, revealing it’s GOMEZ, staggering back... But she’s being held up. Like a puppet. And then she fall Collapsing in a lifeless heap a dozen feet from Rebecca..  94. But her SILHOUETTE REMAINS standing -- Diana. Diana was h puppeteer, behind Gomez like a physical shadow. Rebecca, wide-eyed with fear, grabs hold of Martin and st crawling away from Diana, holding out the black light -- Diana’s arm moves like a snake striking and KNOCKS the li out of Rebecca’s hand -- And it SMASHES against the wall, the bulb shattering. Rebecca turns and pushes Martin for the door --

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Go! And he runs, but she doesn’t get far: Diana GRABS Rebecca by the neck and SHOVES her to the flo Pitch-black clawed HANDS encircle Rebecca’s throat. She can't breathe. Struggling against Diana, fists poundi and legs bucking, but it’s like fighting an onyx statue. Martin returns, in a panic --

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: Stop it! -- and he’s backhanded, thrown back. Diana’s attention returns to Rebecca. Choking the life ou her. That black hair dangling in Rebecca's face. And then:

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I told you. SOPHIE stands in the room, pointing one of the Officer's handguns at Diana. Gone is the manic woman we knew. Stand here, legs slightly apart, is a woman of pure determinati

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You don’t hurt my kids. DIANA’S VOICE They won't let me be your friend. Sophie FIRES -- But we know the result: Diana BLINKS out of existence for that moment of muzzle-blast --  95. Rebecca SUCKS IN A BREATH for a second before Diana RETUR and immediately clamps down on her neck. DIANA’S VOICE (CONT’D) That won't hurt me... And then Sophie puts the gun to her own head.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE
dialogues.text: This will. (then) My daughter was right. I let you in. I let you stay. You are here because of me. This gets Diana’s attention. Her chokehold on Rebecca eas up, just enough for Rebecca to croak out the words --

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Mom -- what are you doing --

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE
dialogues.text: A tear streaks down her cheek, but she says with convicti

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE
dialogues.text: Saving your lives.

dialogues.speaker: BACK ON REBECCA
dialogues.text: At the sound of a single GUNSHOT that causes Diana to VAN in mid-screech. Rebecca sits up, coughing. But can’t take her eyes off: Her mother’s body. In a heap on the floor. Dead. Eyes welling with tears, she crawls to Sophie.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: No... Martin comes to and sees the aftermath.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: Mom? Mom...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From outside looking in through the bay window, two small figures (Rebecca and Martin) huddle over their dead mothe Their bodies shudder from sudden grief. And then Rebecca raises her head and we see the silent wail of raw pain.  96.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bird's eye view of the block shrouded in darkness... And then the power is restored. Street lamps awaken.

dialogues.speaker: DISSOLVE TO
dialogues.text: INT. SOPHIE’S LIVING ROOM - NIGHT Paramedics hoist up the gurney, locking its wheels in pla Sophie’s body now rests under a sheet on it. Rebecca stands back, watching them carry out her mother’s body while the lights of emergency vehicles flare across interior of the room through the window. A beat. Rebecca looks down at the floor where Sophie’s bo had been moments ago. A SHADOW remains on the spot. Darkening the wood. In the exact pose as Sophie. Rebecca stares. Fists clenched. More angry than scared no Slowly, the shadow EVAPORATES before our eyes. And then it’s gone. And Rebecca un-clenches her fists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Later still. Rebecca and Martin sit on the back bumper of parked ambulance. Both of them are wrapped in blankets. They look utterly spent. Bret approaches. A little worse for wear, but with bottle water for them. Rebecca scoots over so he can sit with them. For a beat they simply lean on each other. Then, Rebecca nudges Bret.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: I thought it was too much for you, and you ran off. But you came back.

dialogues.speaker: BRET
dialogues.text: Of course.  97. Rebecca looks at Martin, who gazes up at her like a lost puppy. Unsure of his future.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: (to Martin) So did I. And I’m here to stay. Martin holds onto his sister. Two PARAMEDICS load Sophie into an ambulance, the body covered in a white sheet. The mood turns sad once more. Especially for Martin, who looks hollowed-out by this loss. His one remaining hope:

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: Is Diana finally gone? CLOSE ON REBECCA, finding her strength again. Using a dam towel from the ambulance, she wipes off her mascara. No m hiding behind a warrior’s mask. The warrior is here.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: She better be. PULLING BACK for one last view of the neighborhood... FADE TO BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: FADE UP ON
dialogues.text: EXT. REBECCA’S APARTMENT BUILDING - EVENING Sundown. One week later. Rebecca, Bret, and Martin march up the steps to her front door. They're all dressed in black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A slow pan around the place -- it looks remarkably differ from the last time we saw it. Gone are the heavy metal posters, save for one that shows ascension of a Valkyrie to Asgard. The place is cleaned up. Reorganized. Some new furniture. some adopted from Sophie’s house. The three tired mourners settle in for the night as they in from the front stoop.  98.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Okay, little man, you got school tomorrow, so let’s get you prepped for the morning.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: I got it.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Well then, show me so I know what “got it” looks like. Martin nods and moves off for the back room. Bret stays with Rebecca. Puts a hand on her.

dialogues.speaker: BRET
dialogues.text: It’ll work out.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Will it? INT. REBECCA’S KITCHEN - NIGHT Bret makes a sandwich at the counter. Rebecca joins him. She’s now dressed down in sweats, her tied behind her. Somewhere from the living room, the soft sounds of the TV

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: He likes the triangle cut.

dialogues.speaker: BRET
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: And the crust is okay.

dialogues.speaker: BRET
dialogues.text: (grins) I know. Rebecca paces. Bret offers her a slice of cheese. She takes it.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: What if--

dialogues.speaker: BRET
dialogues.text: No sense worrying.  99. The doorbell rings. Rebecca and Bret trade looks. Expectant. Clearly Rebecca’ been waiting for this. INT. REBECCA’S LIVING ROOM - MOMENTS LATER She opens the door to reveal EMMA at her stoop. With an envelope in her hands.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: (beat) Hey. Emma smiles. Hands her the envelope.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Did they...?

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: Understand, it’s not a formal adoption. But yes. You are now a foster parent. Rebecca jumps a little and then relaxes.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Thank you so much.

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: Well, you’re the one who did the work and-- oh! Rebecca pulls Emma into a big, earnest hug.

dialogues.speaker: MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: Rebecca closes the door and turns around, smiling-- To find Martin and Bret waiting like two pets.

dialogues.speaker: BRET
dialogues.text: Well?

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: We're a family! Martin smiles.

dialogues.speaker: BRET
dialogues.text: I knew it! We’re celebrating.  100.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: Popcorn and movies?

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Not so fast, school boy.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: Awww.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: C'mon, time for bed. EXT. REBECCA’S APARTMENT BUILDING - NIGHT Later. The neon sign winks by their bedroom window... But interior lights now extinguish. It’s bedtime. INT. REBECCA’S LIVING ROOM - NIGHT Later. The middle of the night. A lone night light shines in this room, illuminating the bed where Martin sleeps... Except he’s not asleep. He’s sitting up. And his eyes are SQUINTING at the brightness of the night light. He holds up his pale arm to protect him from it. Martin then crawls to the coffee table against the edge o the bed and places something on it. As a gift. An offerin It’s his mother’s HAIRBRUSH. INT. REBECCA’S BEDROOM - NIGHT Rebecca and Bret sleep together in her bed. This room has been redone as well. Not to the point Rebec has lost her personality, just... matured a step. And also, some of Bret’s stuff is here. Including an elec guitar in the corner and a cloth-covered rig that looks l it might be a homemade amplifier. Night lights illuminate this room, too. There’s at least in every room, actually. The digital clock flickers at 1:57am. Precisely that time And then--  101. Power cuts out. The whole place goes dark. CLOSING IN on Rebecca, asleep. Pressing closer. Closer. A faint SCRATCHING sound creeps in. Enough to wake her. She blinks. Looks around. And fear sets in. The scratching continues. Rebecca looks toward the door-- Drenched in darkness. But in that dark... is... is that a hunched-over FIGURE? Rebecca is almost afraid to speak at it. But then--

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Martin? The SCRATCHING stops suddenly. Rebecca nudges Bret by her side. Bret stirs. Sits up.

dialogues.speaker: BRET
dialogues.text: Hmm?

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: (sotto) Emergency plan. This wakes him up in a heartbeat. He reaches for the shel his side of the bed-- --and the silhouette of AN ARM from under the bed CATCHES in its grasp INCHES before Bret can grab a FLASHLIGHT--

dialogues.speaker: BRET
dialogues.text: Becks--! And then he’s YANKED off the bed-- Slamming into THE DRESSER. Out cold. Rebecca pulls something from her nightstand drawer-- is i another flashlight? No. It’s a ROAD FLARE. Which she cracks--  102. Suddenly casting the entire room in a FIERY RED GLOW.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Bret! Bret is unresponsive. But there’s no sign of Diana now. Scurrying from the living room. It draws her attention. Rebecca opens a nightstand drawer on her side and reaches Inside: one item. A FUCKING MACHETE. With knife in one hand and sparking flare in the other, Rebecca ventures for the living room.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Martin? Sound off!

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (beat) I’m here... Rebecca gets to the threshold and then she hears:

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: She says it’s all right... With a fresh fear, she steps into-- INT. REBECCA’S LIVING ROOM --and the red glow of the flare shows Martin on the edge the sofa bed, positioned as if he were just looking at something in the dark space underneath. He’s been crying. But now he’s not.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: You don’t need that this time. Indicating the flare in her hand. He says it too calmly. Why isn’t he scared out of his min It takes Rebecca a beat to find her voice.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Martin. What are you saying.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: She can talk to mom. She’s here to protect me.  103.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: “Protect” you... from what? A hoarse WHISPER from underneath Martin’s sofa-bed, which Martin seems to hear clear as day.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: Anything.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Martin, look at me. You don’t need this. You don’t need her!

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN REBECCA
dialogues.text: She can talk to mom-- That's a lie--

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: She won't go away, please, this is the only way to survive! He says it so desperately, trying so hard to make Rebecca along with it, now it’s clear what Martin is doing. He’s as broken as his mother.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: There’s a better way. She’s not real, you hear me? And we can’t let her become real. Listen-- Something scurries in the kitchen. Rebecca whirls around with the flare, trying to see in. No sign. Of anything. Shadows thrown left and right. DIANA’S VOICE (0.S.) Becksss... From one corner. Then, a slightly different intonation: DIANA’S VOICE (0.S.) (CONT'D) (lower pitch) Becksss... From somewhere else. Playing with Rebecca.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: Please, don’t make her mad... And then from the bedroom: BRET’S VOICE (0.S.) Becks?  104.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Bret? She starts back for her bedroom but stops-- her flare is only light source here. If she leaves, Martin is back in total darkness again. Rebecca goes to Martin and hands him the flare.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Here. Hold onto this at the base. Okay? I’1l be right back.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: What are you going to use? Rebecca holds up the machete to show him a personal addit to one side of the blade: A compact PEN LIGHT, taped in place. She clicks it on-- It’s black light. INT. REBECCA’S BEDROOM - MOMENTS LATER Rebecca enters, holding knife with white knuckles.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Bret? In the weak, bluish light, she finds Bret’s body still pa out at the foot of the dresser. It wasn’t Bret. Diana’s silhouette STRIKES from behind-- And Rebecca FALLS HARD, hair already matted with her own blood. The machete skitters off to the corner by the guitar. Rebecca tries to get up-- But Diana’s silhouette STRIKES her again and Rebecca’s ea gets a nasty gash. Rebecca crawls for the part of the room where the machete lies, tauntingly close... TIGHT ON REBECCA’S BLOODY FACE. A heavy weight descends on her. Pinning her. It hurts.  105. HER HAND struggles to reach for the direction of the mach by the power supply to the homemade amp. DIANA’S HAIR drifts down by Rebecca’s face. She reaches again. The knife is a good foot away. DIANA’S VOICE I just want to be your friend...

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: (disgusted) You're dead. Her hand touches the power supply. AND NOW WE SEE THE LABEL on the thing. It’s a BATTERY PAC With an old-school radio SWITCH. Diana digs into Rebecca’s flesh, whispering: DIANA’S VOICE You can't run away this time. Rebecca turns onto her back, to face Diana--

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Neither can you, bitch. And she flips the switch. It’s not an amplifier. It’s a LIGHTING RIG. VRRRRM -- first a set of heavy-duty BLACK LIGHTS clack on And Diana is EXPOSED as the demonic-looking woman atop Rebecca in the darkened bedroom. Her wicked grin vanishes when she looks up at the rig-- Just in time to see the second set of lights power on-- BRIGHT FLOODLIGHTS like a set of high-beams. DIANA SCREAMS in agony-- From a LOW ANGLE BEHIND HER, the silhouette now made fles the black light is TURNED TO ASH by the flood lights. She DISSOLVES and blows away like powder in a stiff breez Rebecca takes a breath. Two. Props up on her elbows. Looks around.  106. Bret MOANS and begins to wake. Then, the power returns.
